description: Send a message to the manager that the system is going to reboot.
The variable is the reason why the system reboots.
The variable is the description of sytsem problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause

description: Send a message to the manager that the system is going to shutdown.
The variable is the reason that causes the system to shutdown.
The variable is the description of sytsem problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause

description: Send a message to the manager that the system is overheated.
The variable in the binding list is the current temperature in Celsius
of the system.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZYXEL-AS-MIB::overheat ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempIndex i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempCurValue i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus i 0

description: The identity of the sensor.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempIndex

description: The current temperature detected in Celsius by the sensor.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempCurValue

description: This variable indicates the status of the system.
The sysCurrentStatus is a bit map represented
as a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects
simultaneously. The sysNoDefect should be set if and only if
no other flag is set.
The various bit positions are:
1 sysNoDefect
2 sysOverHeat
3 sysFanRpmLow
4 sysVoltageLow
5 sysThermalSensorFailure
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus

description: Send a message to the manager that the overheated condition is over.
The variable in the binding list is the current temperature in Celsius
of the system.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZYXEL-AS-MIB::overheatOver ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempIndex i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempCurValue i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus i 0

description: The identity of the sensor.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempIndex

description: The current temperature detected in Celsius by the sensor.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSysTempCurValue

description: This variable indicates the status of the system.
The sysCurrentStatus is a bit map represented
as a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects
simultaneously. The sysNoDefect should be set if and only if
no other flag is set.
The various bit positions are:
1 sysNoDefect
2 sysOverHeat
3 sysFanRpmLow
4 sysVoltageLow
5 sysThermalSensorFailure
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus

description: Send a message to the manager that an error log is created in system.
The variable in the binding list is the content of the error log.

event.Summary: Error log ($v1) is created in the system

description: The variable is the description of system problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause

description: Send a message to the manager that the rpm of the fan is too low.
The variable in the binding list is the current rpm of the fan.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZYXEL-AS-MIB::fanRpmLow ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchFanRpmIndex i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchFanRpmCurValue i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus i 0

description: The identity of the fan.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchFanRpmIndex

description: The current rpm of the fan.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchFanRpmCurValue

as a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects
simultaneously. The sysNoDefect should be set if and only if
no other flag is set.
The various bit positions are:

description: Send a message to the manager that the low-rpm condition of the fan is over.
The variable in the binding list is the current rpm of the fan.

description: Send a message to the manager that the voltage of the system is out of range.
The variable in the binding list is the current voltage in volt
of the system.

event.Summary: System voltage ($v2) is out of range

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ZYXEL-AS-MIB::voltageOutOfRange ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchVoltageIndex i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchVoltageCurValue i 9999 ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchSystemCurrentStatus i 0

description: The identity of the sensor.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchVoltageIndex

description: The current voltage detected by the sensor (in milli-voltage).
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchVoltageCurValue

description: This variable indicates the status of the system.
The sysCurrentStatus is a bit map represented
as a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects
simultaneously. The sysNoDefect should be set if and only if
no other flag is set.
The various bit positions are:
1 sysNoDefect
2 sysOverHeat
3 sysFanRpmLow
4 sysVoltageLow

description: Send a message to the manager that the low-voltage condition is over.
The variable in the binding list is the current voltage in volt
of the system.

description: Send a message to the manager that the system maintence operation
fail. The variable in the variable binding indicates the problem.
The variable is the description of sytsem problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause

description: Send a message to the manager that the system configuration
data is changed.
The variable is the description of sytsem problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause

description: The trap signifies that the thermal sensor failed.
The variable is the description of sytsem problem.
variables.name: ZYXEL-AS-MIB::accessSwitchProblemCause
